Fields.DialogueText: *ALARM*
@BATTLE
Ciao, Capitano! Pleasure to see you.
Likewise, Amerigo. Do you need anything from me?

Fields.MenuText: Sparred? Do you mean fighting?
If it’s a match of wits, I’m sorry. I already played one of those this morning with another captain.
What do you take me for? Some kind of martial artist?

Fields.DialogueText: Si! There is nothing better to start your day with than the excitement and energy that comes with dueling!
Someone’s wit is only as sharp as someone’s blade, Capitano. You need a whetstone!
You do not need to be well versed in martial arts, though it is encouraged. Now come, Capitano, and show me your best!
Well, I haven’t exercised yet today. Where would you like to spar? And what will I be using?
Amerigo?
Capitano, you’re supposed to salute! I am a ship, after all—it’s customary to show me some respect!
All right, how’s this? Good day, Training Ship Amerigo Vespucci!
Buon giorno, Captain! A good start, but we'll work on your form. And from now on, you shall address me as Vespucci.
Understood, Vespucci. Do you need anything from me?
I should ask that of you, Capitano! You haven't sparred yet today, have you?
I shall provide you with the time-honored parry dagger and epee, Capitano. Do not worry about wounds, either - this is a fencing sword!
What about the dagger?
We can worry about that later, Capitano. For now, let us make for the deck!
I’ll give it a shot. I just hope we don’t annoy the crew!
Looks like the Morganas already have.
Our duel will have to be on hold then, Capitano. Let’s move!
Come, Capitano! Strike harder!
You're *huff* really fast...
And you're too slow, Capitano.
I can see that!
Watch and study my movements! A true duelist is always thinking one step ahead!
Then allow me to...
Ah! I know what you're trying to do! Take this!
Ack!
And this round... is mine!
Congratulations, Vespucci. You're up 3-1.
You’re no slouch yourself, Capitano! Your form is quite good for someone totally new to this sport.

Fields.MenuText: Do you have any recommendations for me to improve?
You’re too fast for me, Vespucci. How do you do it?
Your movements are beautiful. I think I’m starting to slowly see through them...

Fields.DialogueText: You take your strikes too far and don’t go for short bursts. You have a nasty habit of flailing your parry dagger when things look bad, as well. My advice? Be confident; be adventurous!
Simple! I am always thinking ahead. You should try it, Capitano. While my movements may seem fast, they’re not; they’re predictions. You must not be afraid, Capitano.
Beautiful? ... How flattering! Grazie, Capitano. I’m sure you’ll see through them eventually, but you need to be more confident in your abilities.
I see. I'll work on my confidence when I can.
Keep it in the back of your head at all times! A successful Belle should always remain confident in her abilities no matter what. The same should go for you!
*flick* *fidget*
Hm? Soderini?
Who's that?
Oh, scusami, Capitano! This is Soderini. He is my partner and my most trusted advisor.
A... chameleon?
And an exceptionally learned one at that. Listen!
*flick* *flick* *fidget* Ssss...
An excellent point, Soderini. I believe we should do that straight away.
... What does he suggest?
A shower and a cup of tea. Shall we?
Sounds like a plan.
I shall see you for tea then, Capitano!
*ALARM*
I think I may see you sooner than I anticipated.
Così è la vita... Be confident, Capitano!
@BATTLE
Buon giorno, Capitano!
Good day, Vespucci!
Capitano, your salute is in excellent form! It’s much better than the last one.
Thank you, Vespucci, I’ve been working on it. Now, your report.
Si, Capitano. It's about the Morganas.
Are they about?
Hahaha! No, no, not right now. I just wanted to ask you: how do you go about combating them? Rather, what’s your strategy?

Fields.MenuText: I throw everything I have at them until nothing remains!
I approach carefully and systematically take them out one by one.
The Morganas are an enigma. I just charge in and hope for the best.

Fields.DialogueText: Ferocity is one key to it! But there's something I think you're missing.
Slow and steady is sometimes the best. But there's something you're missing.
Acknowledging your blind spots and adapting is important, but there's something else you must know.
What would that be, Vespucci?
The great Antisthenes once said: "Observe your enemies, for they are the first to find your faults." The next time we battle Morganas, I encourage you to watch their movements and learn from them.
They're an erratic enemy. Are you sure it can be done?
More than that, Capitano - I know it can. After all, that's how I figured you out in our duel.
*ALARM*
Speak of the devil...
And she shall appear!
One step ahead as always.
Indeed! Worry not, Capitano - you’ll reach me if you keep trying.
@BATTLE
Buon giorno, Capitano!
Good day, Vespucci!
Your salute, Capitano... It’s absolutely perfect! Che bello!
I've gotten some suggestions from the other captains about it.
Practice makes perfect. So, how did your investigation on the Morganas go? Did you learn anything?

Fields.MenuText: They're... a lot like you Belles, actually. They attack in formation often. But they each have their differences.
They're spooky, but they're not invincible. They're unorthodox, so it's best to fight back in unorthodox ways.
They're an enigma... and now I must be too, because I’m close to figuring them out.

Fields.DialogueText: Si. I’ve noticed it myself. It’s almost as if they were once sleeping ships themselves...
They sometimes do inexplicable things... Approaching them with an unorthodox tactic is a brilliant idea!
Now that’s some self-confidence right there! Be careful, though! Aesop once said: “The smaller the mind, the greater the conceit.” That being said, you're doing better, Capitano.
Nevertheless! You’re starting to understand the value of knowing your enemy!
Just as long as I don't get overconfident.
A fine line indeed to walk. I compare it to drawing a map or reading a dense book.
Speaking of which, Vespucci... you're a Belle. Your perspective on war is unique. Do you have any recommendations? You know, authors, stories, and the like?
Yes, absolutely! You would do well with Epictatus, Plato, Aesop, and the great Marcus Aurelius. Perhaps Hemingway as well, if you prefer someone living.
Going on the list. Do you have time for a spar?
I’d love to, Capitano - but please let me check with Soderini.
*fidget* *fidget* Sss... Ss... Ssss...
Morganas? Capitano, our duel will have to wait!
Just in time to try some new tactics.
Let's see them!
@BATTLE
You seem deep in thought, Capitano. Is everything alright?
I’m sorry, Vespucci, I’ve been reading and now I’m thinking.
You've taken to reading - che bello! Who are you reading, if I may ask?
I’ve been reading a bit of Marcus Aurelius. One of the other deckhands lent me a copy of Meditations.
Tell me, then... what did the great Aurelius say about opinions?
“Reverence the faculty which produces opinion.” Basically, he means that you should listen to others and build upon the rational opinions while separating fact and fiction.
My, my... Excellent, Capitano. Will you be applying that to your dueling as well?
“Let no act be done without a purpose, nor otherwise than according to the perfect principles of art,” after all.
Well, look at you. You pick up one book and your habits improve immensely!
“It is no evil for things to undergo change, and no good for things to subsist in consequence of change.” Is that right?
Hmph! You’re getting quite cheeky, Capitano. How about a bit of sparring?
I'd love to--
*fidget* *fidget* *fidget*
What is it, Soderini?
Ssss... *flick* *flick*
What is he suggesting, Vespucci?
Capitano, would you like to come to my quarters? I want to show you something that is important to me.

Fields.MenuText: If you're comfortable with it.
I'm a little afraid of what I might find.
I'm surprised you hadn't already.

Fields.DialogueText: Certo. I need to ask you, however... can I be given some time to prepare? There is some cartography I need to complete.
Nothing dangerous, Capitano! Unless you have a great fear of books and maps.
I am happy to share my knowledge! Only... my organizational methods can be rather unorthodox. The maps alone...
You draw maps?
Of the stars, the ocean, and whatever else catches my fancy. After all, a true adventurer is a navigator at heart.
I wish some of the crew could learn that from you. You wouldn’t believe what I see sometimes...
They'll learn just as you have. And I'll have a strong pot of barley tea for when you visit.
From China or thereabouts? How'd you get your hands on that?
Adventurers are also traders!
News to me.
“If you do not expect the unexpected, you will not recognize it when it arrives.” Heraclitus once said that.
Speaking of things unexpected...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Buon giorno, Capitano! You're neither early nor late, I see.
Expect the unexpected, remember?
Good day, Vespucci. May I come in?
Vero... Please, come in! Forgive the tea - it's warming up still.

Fields.MenuText: How do you fit all this in your quarters?
All this... well, I'm sure it makes sense to you.
What's the map over there? And... why is it connected to that star chart?

Fields.DialogueText: Your awestruck expression is cute, do you know? Welcome to my quarters! It's a bit unorganized right now, since I was taking notes.
Perfect sense, Capitano! Welcome to my lair. I've been taking notes furiously. This is what that looks like.
All in good time, Capitano! Welcome to my quarters. What you see is my note taking in progress.
Thank you for the welcome. What notes were you taking?
By using the constellations over on that wall and analyzing the route I took last summer to the Americas, I’ve been able to create an efficient route to that continent.
Going by this map... What would be the most optimal route to New York?
Let me show you... By heading out of Italy around Sardegna, we can use the beaches near the coastline to generate great speed.
We can then maintain this speed by following the Canary Current down to the North Equatorial and then shoot up through the Gulf Stream!
Fascinating... though I think I see an improvement.
Impossibile. I've been mapping this route all day.
Well, Vespucci, the Canary Current is a cold current. That means it travels further south and also towards the equator.
However, the North Equatorial Current heads up and to the left towards the Caribbean.
Your point, Capitano?
Well, look at this route you have here. Wouldn’t it be reasonable to take the Canary Current down to the middle of Spanish Sahara and then take a sharp right?
That way you could use the resulting Gulf Stream to swing you up to New York. You're already going fast thanks to the other currents.
Going by that trajectory... No, you’d end up in the Gulf Stream and get shot back to the North Atlantic Drift!
Not so. You see, by heading directly to the right, or in this case west, you would certainly end up heading straight into the Gulf Stream.
However! If you head low enough to the very start of the Gulf Stream, you could use the resulting trajectory from the current to lift you up north while heading straight.
You get to New York quicker without relying on a current that might take you to Cuba.
Would you end up somewhere farther north? Maine, perhaps?
Not if you head by this trajectory. The Canary Current lowers you down just enough so that you hit the mouth of the Gulf Stream when you reach near Florida.
Capitano... I... Hold on a moment. *rustle* *scribble* *rustle*
*rustle* *rustle*
That saves... I see. Nearly a day.
2-1 then, Vespucci?
Si. Si. Two to one, I concede--
*ALARM*
Andiamo! Oh - what if the tea burns?
Kill the fire. It'll be warm by the time we get back. Care to try your luck at evening the score?
Just you watch!
@BATTLE
Davvero? What for?
The tactics you've been helping me with have scored some big wins against the Morganas. Those duels are paying off.
Sorry about missing our morning spar, Vespucci. Officers' meeting.
Ha! Excellent - they still don't know what's hit them! This should prove that the basics of dueling are essential and universal.

Fields.MenuText: I couldn't have done any of this without you.
Who knew that old tricks worked on new enemies?
What next? Finding safe routes around the Morganas?

Fields.DialogueText: Capitano... I... Grazie. That means quite a lot to me. But you shouldn’t sell yourself short! After all, I find myself learning from you sometimes...
There is a reason the ways of old have been preserved, Capitano!
Impossible for now, Capitano. They seem frustratingly free from the tyranny of distance.
Tell me, Vespucci - if you’re an adventurer, do you like to explore?
Si, Capitano! I’ve been as far as the west coast of the United States and the frigid shores of Denmark... before I'd awakened, of course. I should like very much to experience it properly!
Well, Vespucci, my superiors have given me the go-ahead to perform an expedition. Can I ask for your help in this?
Why, Capitano, I'd love to!
We're needed in the Levant. We'll establish a supply depot there to protect the coastline from the Morganas there.
Well, Capitano, I’d love to be your guide. Don’t worry. With my expertise we’ll map the entire land out and still have time for tea afterward.
Well, there are already maps of--
*ALARM*
Senza senso! An uninvited guest is just another way to say "practice targets." Care to test your skills, Captain?
Looks like we've got uninvited guests.
With my training partner? Of course!
@BATTLE
Hah... hah... Ah! Dio-- Mi dispiace, Capitano. I'm just... deep in training right now.
Vespucci, don't you think you're a bit too... into it?
Good day... Vespucci?
Senza senso! I'm fine! And the training dummy knows this all too well! Have at you!
“If it is not right do not do it; if it is not true do not say it.”
Aurelius. Capitano, I...
Come on, Vespucci, you can be frank with me.
... Capitano, have you ever heard of Cristoforo Colombo?

Fields.MenuText: The training ship? Your sister?
Can't say I have.
The guy who proved the world was round, right?

Fields.DialogueText: The very same!
I am not the only training ship in the Regia Marina, Capitano. I have a sister... try as I might sometimes to forget this.
Lies! That had been known for centuries. No, Capitano, he simply got lost on the way to Asia.
But it is not he that vexes me. It is my sister, who bears his name!
And I won't ever let her get the better of me! Hah!
What's so bad about your sister?
"What's so bad?" Capitano, you don't understand. It is natural that people look to me as a duelist and adventurer.
They must not look to Cristoforo! I will not let her outdo me!
I don't think that Cristoforo would dream of it. Come, Vespucci. Let's talk about this. If you tire yourself out, you won't  be ready for--
*ALARM*
Grr! Looks like we'll have to deal with this first...
Let's work out some of that aggression, Vespucci.
@BATTLE
Buon giorno, Capitano. I must apologize for my conduct the other day.
It's all right, Vespucci. But permit me to ask... what is it about your sister that irks you?
It’s not that she irks me, Capitano. It’s the fact that we’re the same.. We’re almost identical in every way. A metal hull, a wooden deck, cannons, sails, and yet...
Vespucci, have you considered that Cristoforo might be more approachable?
Gah! Why do people look up to her? What does she have that I don't?
Cosa intendi? What do you mean by "approachable?" You know me for a forthright Bella Fantasma!
Honesty may be the best policy, but there's something to be said for subtlety. If you're overly direct, it can make others feel awkward.
Subtlety... I must admit that I hadn't considered it.
There's room for moderation in everything. It’s like my ego, remember?
I see. Could you perhaps teach me about this moderation, the way I am teaching you about your ego?

Fields.MenuText: Are you sure? You're more of a teacher than I am.
I'd be delighted, Vespucci. True adventurers are students of the world.
It's an instinct. That's sort of a difficult thing to teach.

Fields.DialogueText: Ah, but the best teachers are eternal students!
And I am nothing if not a true adventurer!
Instinct is nothing more than muscle memory, Capitano. You know this from our dueling!
Then let's start with a hands-on lesson.
What do you mean by--
*ALARM*
The way the Morganas snuck up on us just now? Subtlety. Are you ready?
Oh, very clever, Capitano! Pronto all'azione!
@BATTLE
Capitano! In an effort to reach out to other Belles, I have begun writing a pen pal.
Excellent! Feel free to use the teletype.
... Forgive me, Capitano. What is a teletype?
A radioteletype. The INPF are trying to get them on all Belle ships. You could just get their frequency and then send messages to them that way.
Did you type your letter out, at least? I imagine you had a ton to say.
I have a typewriter for daily reports. I write all of my letters with pencil and then highlight all of the writing with an ink pen.

Fields.MenuText: Classy. You don't see much of that these days!
You know you can just write letters with your typewriter, right?
Can I see your letters? I’m curious about your handwriting. Given your maps, I bet it’s beautiful.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not sure it's as fancy as all that. That's just how I send letters. Are you telling me that there are other ways?
Don’t be daft, Capitano. That typewriter is supposed to be for military use only!
I'd be glad to share. You are my capitano, after all. I've never had my handwriting called beautiful before...
You can use your typewriter for sending letters. It’s fine to do so. Common, even.
Dear me... It appears I still have much to learn. Regardless, I’ll still send letters locally. Letters are reliable, and I’m a reliable ship!
I’m a reliable captain, aren’t I? It’s only natural that I’d want a reliable ship. Who have you been sending letters to? Or rather, who is your pen pal?
I’ve been interested in meeting another Belle that has an affinity for dueling. She comes from lands to the east in which true warriors live by their blades.
One of the Japanese Belles? You're talking about the samurai?
Funny you should mention them. I've started talking to Ashigara! To my knowledge, her people's soldiers still use swords in battle! Never let it be said that old technology cannot be practical!
Those are only issued to officers, if I remember correctly. Ceremonial.
Hmm. It seems I have more to learn. What fun!
*ALARM*
Got your blade handy?
And a few other things besides!
@BATTLE
Tell me about it, Capitano - I can tell you're excited!
We've got new orders regarding the Levant.
Good news, Vespucci!
Are we finally going? I can hardly believe it!
Within the next couple of hours, if you're ready.
Perfetto! This calls for my eastern Mediterranean maps. With me at your side, this expedition is as good as done already!
*SOME TIME LATER*
It's gorgeous here, Vespucci. No wonder Cyprus has been fought over for centuries.
Such a shame for the Ottomans that they lost it. A further shame that it didn't go to Italy... it is too good for gli inglesi!
Now, then - shall we establish our base here?
Closer to Turkey, Command said. They left it up to us from there.
Hmm. You know, Chiron once taught Achilles the value of seeking truth through the world's lies.
And then Achilles was shot in the heel...
Does that matter if we find what we're looking for?
If you're going to take an arrow, at least let me fire it. I promise to miss anything vital.
Hahaha! You've been studying well! Your wit's almost as sharp as the dagger you've started training with.

Fields.MenuText: And yours, Vespucci. You could cut my hair with your observations alone.
I'll say. That steel is no joke...
I'd never shoot you with an arrow, of course. It wouldn't do anything.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! I'd shear you bald if that were true!
I'll consider your training complete if you can pierce me with it!
Of course not! I am made of steel, after all.
Here’s another observation, Capitano. We’re not alone out here!
Should have figured. Right, Vespucci - to arms!
Si, Capitano! Difenderò Cipro!
@BATTLE
Latakia... It's dangerous here, Capitano. I've heard terrible things about what the French terror has done to this land!

Fields.MenuText: "They condemn what they do not understand."
It's heartbreaking what people will do for land and power and beliefs.
It's hard to reason with people in the middle of war.

Fields.DialogueText: I wish Cicero's words wouldn't ring so true. I am reminded of Il Duce, making an ally of the devil...
Beliefs are a double-edged sword, Capitano. Especially here in this part of the world.
Isn't it just? Have you tried talking to the German Belles!? They won’t listen to me, even with my forthrightness!
Vespucci... What do you think of the war that’s happening in Europe?
War... War means adventure, Capitano. I’m happy for the brave italiano who dared to head out into the field to journey! Yet... There are things that I simply can’t agree with.
I understand, Vespucci. I apologize if I made you feel uncomfortable.
Senza senso, Capitano! It was a good question. Back on track... Following the coast, it will be 200 kilometers to Dortyol.
That'll take forever with the Morganas about.
Even among many enemies, against impossible odds, a true duelist finds the path to victory.
I trust you, Vespucci.
Capitano... I trust you as well. Sul mio onore, I promise we'll reach Dortyol safe and sound.
I promise, Vespucci. No matter what happens, I’ll be right by your side to keep you from harm.
Harm and danger are only in your mind. Battle is the only thing that you should focus on! Besides, we can possibly visit Constantinople once this is over! To walk in Justinian’s shoes...
Don't you mean Istanbul?
Forgive me, Capitano. My soul is... from another time.
*ALARM*
Looks like we've got company.
Foul fiends! Sea witches! You’ll not stop my advance! Combattere!
We'll take them all on!
@BATTLE
Try me!
Submit!
Troppo lento!
We will rise again...
Captain! There's more of them approaching from the south!
There too? Damn, we're being pincered!
Pincered!? Cowards... Come with me, Capitano! I'll show them how a real duelist fights!
@BATTLE
Hmph! They should know better than to pick a fight with someone who's studied them!
We've spotted more, Miss! East, 105!
Let's see... Far enough that we could leave them in our wake.

Fields.MenuText: And miss our quota? Not a chance!
Can you keep the fight going?
Maybe that's the right idea. We don't want to get in over our heads.

Fields.DialogueText: You can't put a number on victory, Capitano... but you can count quite high! Let's move!
To the ends of the earth if I have to!
Get me close enough, Capitano, and there is no Morgana I cannot best!
Sailor! How far are we from port?
Just under an hour at this pace!
Why, we've barely struck out! Shall we continue, Capitano?
Be my guest, Vespucci!
Through the fire... There! Ti ho preso adesso!
There!
Ci siamo!
@BATTLE
Youuuuu...
Not interested! Salvo, Vespucci!
Grrrr...
*BOOM*
She's no match for me!
*BOOM*
Beautiful shot!
Captain! We've got a heavy cruiser closing in!
Indeed they have. You've grown as well, Capitano!

Fields.MenuText: The crew have been practicing hard.
It was nothing. That Morgana was bug-eyed from the beginning!
Not as beautiful as you, Vespucci.

Fields.DialogueText: Nothing? I've seen Belles have trouble with shots like that!
Capitano! ... Hmph! It surprises me that even in the heat of battle you have time to flirt. You're growing into a fine soldier.
Where shall we head now, Capitano? We've been advised to steer clear of Dortyol for now.
Don’t worry about that, Vespucci. I’ve received new orders from HQ. We’re to head to Antalya as soon as we can. The Morganas are threatening to overrun Athens and we need to establish a base.
I can’t believe how many of them there were. We're lucky we were able to make an emergency supply run.
Dio Mio... How have they covered this much ground this quickly? ... No matter. I'll strike through them all, Capitano.
I believe you will, Vespucci. For now, we have to resupply and then head along the coast. Can you navigate us through the shoals?
Grace under pressure, Capitano. I will do it well.
*LATER THAT EVENING*
Capitano, why are you still awake? You should rest up! We haven’t run into a Morgana for at least four hours.
You don't need to worry about me, Vespucci. I need to coordinate this approach.
I have utmost faith in you, Capitano! ... It’s just that Soderini suggested I check in.
He's a good boy.
Sometimes it feels like we've done nothing but fight. I know sleep is important, but the crew mean a lot to me.
They mean a lot to me too, Capitano. But a crew without a capitano is like Florence without a gonfaloniere.
*fidget* *fidget* Ssss...
I'm sorry, Soderini. I don't follow.
He's saying that if you must stay up, we should stay right next to you.
I assure you I’ll be fine. Besides, It’s the quietest it's been in a couple days.
Perfect for some stargazing! If you look to the north from where we are, you will see Camelopardalis.

Fields.MenuText: That ‘M’ shape to the northeast... That’s Cassiopeia, right?
Are those three stars under Camelopardalis supposed to be the head of something?
You know, I like how you glow in the starlight, Vespucci.

Fields.DialogueText: Have you been researching, Capitano? Indeed, that’s Cassiopeia. The Queen who thought she was so beautiful that she incurred the wrath of Poseidon.
Good eye, Capitano. That’s Ursa Minor. It’s like a bear rising to the occasion. It’s not unlike what we’re doing right now.
Capitano... Your confidence is something that many aspire to. Please, don’t lose it.
I’m giving it my all here. I'm glad we can *yawn* find some time to stargaze.
Hohoho! Capitano, you’re going to pass out at this point. Please, you should rest!
I don’t think that’s an option right now, Vespucci.
What do you mean?
*ALARM*
Oh... Blasted sea witches.
Ssss... *fidget* *fidget*
Soderini orders you to rest after this engagement, Capitano.
Yes, Signore Soderini... *yawn*
@BATTLE
Buon giorno, Capitano. We’ve arrived in Antalya. Tell me, where does Command say this base can be set up?
Near Athens. We'll rendezvous here and set out in force.
Perhaps with aid from Constantinople?
Our next stop is Fethiye. I promise you, once we’re done we’ll go see Istanbul. We'll have time after we deal with Athens.
I’m prepared to work hard for it, Capitano. I see Morganas trying to hem us in... so close and yet so far! How should we proceed?

Fields.MenuText: If we attack them head-on, it’d be a disaster. Let’s try to pincer them.
We’ll approach in an unorthodox fashion, list a bit to the right, and then be upon them!
I think we’ll just play it by ear.

Fields.DialogueText: I like that plan. They won’t be able to escape easily!
Such elegant movements... Hmph! I’ll do my best.
Sometimes, that’s all you can do. Let’s be about it, Capitano!
@BATTLE
This is the place? It doesn't look like much.
You've looked over the Aegean charts. This is definitely the location Command was referring to.
Well, then, Capitano - care to go exploring?

Fields.MenuText: I'd love to!
It looks like that's been left to us.
Let's stay focused. We're not looking for buried treasure.

Fields.DialogueText: That’s the right attitude! Let us press on!
Nothing ventured, nothing gained, Capitano.
Don't close your mind to new possibilities, Capitano! But yes, we do have a goal here.
*SOME TIME LATER*
I’m getting the feeling we’ve strayed too far. Are we lost? We’re lost, aren’t we?
Not at all, Capitano. See? The lights of our ships are still over yonder! And. we are not lost. We’re simply exploring the coast.
The Morgana threat doesn't help. Got any ideas?
Hm... Capitano, do you have your telescope handy? I believe I might have a solution to our problem. Allow me to stargaze for a moment...
Aha! Centaurus, Capitano! The constellation of Chiron! With his guidance, I’m certain we’ll find something of value.
*SHORTLY THEREAFTER*
You were right, Vespucci! There was a cave right where you said it would be.
Curse my bond to this hull! Thank you for sounding that cave, marinaio. What did you find?
It's strange. The cave looks small from the outside, but it's plenty deep - and the water's as clear as anything.
Is it useful, though?
It's certainly roomy. You could fit a small dry dock in there!
What a find! Perhaps we can set up here, Capitano?
The roof's a bit low, but nobody said it had to be comfortable. We can leave it to the engineers.
Si. Everyone’s got their own part to play... We are adventurers, duelists, and explorers of the world!
I’m proud to be one! I'll inform Command right away.
... Capitano?
Yes, Vespucci?
Thank you. Thank you for believing in me.
And thank you for teaching me so much, Vespucci. You're really opening our eyes out here. I'm proud to be your captain.
Capitano, I--
*BOOM*
How did a Morgana get here already!?
Come osi! This discovery is mine, you hear me? Mine!
@BATTLE
With enough manpower and urgency, it’s no surprise. The Regia Marina did well to get our station here. Soon we will be launching ships, soldiers, and supplies to Athens!
We're almost ready to relieve the city, Vespucci.
To think we’ve gotten this whole place almost completely set up in less than a week...
I can feel it in my wooden deck, Capitano. Soon we’ll scatter those Morganas to the winds and liberate the ancient philosophers' capital. I cannot wait!
Once preparations are made here, Command has requested we head out to Athens as soon as we can.
It's high time we took the fight to them!

Fields.MenuText: Like Epictetus, I will act with honor. Those Morganas won’t stand a chance.
It's time to end this farce.
Vespucci, you have my deepest thanks. You truly are a fantastic ship.

Fields.DialogueText: Si! And, remember, Capitano: "It’s not what happens to you, but how you react that matters."
We shall liberate Athens and finally set our feet on the sands where the philosophers walked!
Your words touch my soul, Capitano. As you sing my praises, I will sing yours.
*ALARM*
First things first. Time to dig in!
@BATTLE
People of Athens! We have come to liberate you from the Morganas!
All ships, proceed forth! Vespucci, with me! Let’s win this thing!
They think they can take me? I'll show them, the other Belles, and Cristoforo Colombo most of all!

Fields.MenuText: Ease up, Vespucci!
"If you would cure anger, do not feed it."
Don't forget our real enemy, Vespucci.

Fields.DialogueText: Capitano, we must rout them! I cannot hold back now!
Epictetus never fought ghost ships! We need to run them down!
I've written the Morganas off  completely! It's Cristoforo Colombo I intend to teach a lesson!
Vespucci, we're overextending! We can't do this without a plan.
Capitano... Rrgh, I won’t--
Vespucci. Please.
Capitano...
*Flick* *flick* Sss... Sss... SssSssSssSss...!
Soderini, Capitano... I can’t... The people of Athens are depending on me! To stop fighting now would be disgraceful!
*Flick* *fidget*
Maledizione... Capitano, what do you suggest?
We'll shock one Morgana, then move on to the next one, and bait them one at a time.
They'll go back to their original target once we retreat far enough. If we keep drawing them off, we can slowly and methodically take them all out.
Capitano... Inteso. I’ll do my best to carry it out. Please, point me where you want me to go!
Vespucci, Soderini, thank you! Let’s do it. We’ll get through them in no time!
@BATTLE
Captain, we're putting giant holes in their lines, but they won't break!
We stick to the plan. Vespucci, I want you at your flashiest. Maximum speed!
We must persist! Capitano, your orders!
Si, Capitano! I'm with you!
Meanwhile, I'll have the rest of the fleet go where I send you and meet the stragglers in force.
We'll need quite a lot of force for that one!
*BOOM*
It looks like their lead ship has finally lost her patience. This is one fight we won't be able to shock our way out of.
A true duelist does not shy away from a gauntlet once thrown!

Fields.MenuText: The first and the best victory...
Vespucci, stand by me.
With my comrade in arms, my lady luck, Vespucci!

Fields.DialogueText: ... Is to conquer self! I have no doubts, Capitano!
I’m right here, Capitano! I won’t run - I’ll stand and fight!
With my comrade in arms, my advisor and guardian, Capitano!
@BATTLE
They're scattering, Captain! Athens is saved!
"You have power over your mind, not outside events."
"Realize this, and you will find strength!" Capitano, we've won! We've done it!
You were utterly radiant, Vespucci. Those Morganas didn't stand a chance against us! I’m so proud of you.
Your cheers struck my soul, Capitano! Your tactics, your drive, your perseverance... I'm so happy I could cry!
Dispatch from Command, Captain! "Mission accomplished!"
What should we do now that Athens is freed? Has Command given us any more orders?
They gave us one: "Enjoy Istanbul. You’ve more than earned it."
Che meraviglia!
*Lick* *lick*
Seriously... I can’t... Too tight... !
Scusami, Capitano. Even a tall ship is strong. When should we depart for Constantinople?
Do you need to ask me, Vespucci?
... I feel as if I have seen this situation somewhere before.
Don’t count on it. It’s not like I’ve said this verbatim.
Ha! Let's go!
Welcome to the city of the world's desire!

Fields.MenuText: Cyprus was one thing, but this is majestic!
To be where Constantine once walked...
I've seen better.

Fields.DialogueText: Some of history's greatest rulers crossed these waters.
And Suleiman after him! Does the city breed majesty, or does it attract majestic people, I wonder?
You are lying or joking, Capitano!
“Justice is the firm and continuous desire to render to everyone that which is his due.” If memory serves, that’s one of the first things they teach you in law school.
You went to law school, Capitano?
No, I was never lawyer material. I just happen to really like the quote.
We give quotes to one another so often that it’s hard to distinguish what’s actually real...
“All warfare is based on deception.”
Capitano! That's not funny!
Then why are you giggling, Vespucci?
Because I can’t help it!
Neither can the Morganas, it seems.
*ALARM*
What!? They’re back for more!? Hmph! Time for another lesson...
A lesson? “Find time still to be learning somewhat good, and give up being desultory.”
Capitano, that's... Pfft... hahaha!
@BATTLE
We're still in Istanbul... It feels weird to stay in one place after so much hopping about.
It's not weird to me! One of the greatest explorers ever to live went from island to island until he met his unfortunate end...

Fields.MenuText: Ferdinand Magellan! Now there’s a story for the ages.
Wasn't he killed by some natives he'd angered?

Fields.DialogueText: I’d rather they talk about Ferdinand than my namesake...
He made a deal with the wrong person. I would rather have been named Magellan...

Fields.MenuText: Who are we talking about again?

Fields.DialogueText: Ferdinand Magellan! If I could choose to be renamed...
You don't like being named after Amerigo Vespucci? He gave the New World its name!
I would rather just be called Vespucci. It’s the same with my sister, though I think she likes her namesake more.
Explorers are explorers. You can't deny their influence.
Colombo may have discovered new lands, but what he did to the people living there... it makes my blood boil. No true explorer would behave so monstrously.
What your namesakes did or didn't do... it doesn't change who you are, Vespucci.
And Vespucci... well, some say he didn't even go to all those places he said he did. What does that say about me?
Si! I aim to rise above and beyond! But, you already know that about me, Capitano.
I would know it better than anyone. I want to be the best person I can be, too.
Then let’s strive toward that together! I’ll help you every step of the way!
Starting with those Morganas...
Hmph! Just when you think you’ve gotten rid of them all... To battle!
@BATTLE
Si! ...Capitano, do you know what we haven’t done in a long time?

Fields.MenuText: Eaten something great? Rations are nice, but I’d love to have some cacio e pepe.

Fields.DialogueText: It's good to see the fruits of your labor. Not a single Morgana in the Athens area all week.

Fields.MenuText: We haven’t taken any time to relax. I know we’re at war, but some R&R couldn't hurt.
Dueled? If so, then I’d be more than happy to take you on.

Fields.DialogueText: I’ve always wanted to try that. I’ve heard it’s amazing... But no, Capitano, we need to spar!
Relaxation will make you into a lazybones, Capitano! We need to limber up with some sparring!
You know me too well, Capitano! I’m ready when you are!
You might want to hold that thought, Vespucci.
What? Why? There’s no time like the present to get in some practice!
It sounds like we've got company further into the Aegean. The way the patrols are distributed, we're it.
Tch! You can’t keep a good Morgana down...
You can’t keep us down, either. Let’s show them what for, huh?
@BATTLE
Buon giorno, Capitano. I... feel as though something bad might happen to Greece.
Greece is strong, Vespucci. Didn’t you see how they held their own against the Morganas that came here?
Buon giorno, Vespucci. What's the matter? You seem kind of down.
I can feel it in my deck, Capitano. While they have proven to be great warriors in the past and right now... I can’t shake the feeling. Can we leave some extra supplies for them?

Fields.MenuText: I’ll talk to Command about it. It's not the first time you've been right.
We have some stuff left over from the Athens defense. There’s not much else we can do.
I don't think it's under threat any more than other coastal areas.

Fields.DialogueText: Never sell yourself short, Capitano! Not after what you did in Athens last week. I’ll be mad if you keep doing that!
Understood. Thank you, anyway, Capitano. Your hands are tied...
I want so badly for you to be right, Capitano.
If you don’t mind me asking, what do you think will happen to Greece?
The things that Il Duce says about "spazio vitale..." If I were next door to my country, it would make me nervous.
It certainly isn’t out of the question for him. Do you think we should warn the locals? Perhaps advise them to be careful?
Wouldn’t that violate our code, Capitano? We’re technically supposed to be neutral...
We'd have to do it subtly...
*ALARM*
In other words, exactly the way a Morgana wouldn't.
Hmph! This is the last day we’re here, and they have the nerve to ruin our last few moments? I’ll teach them some respect.
One last hurrah. Let's give them something to remember, Vespucci!
@BATTLE
Capitano... I once again want to thank you for that whole adventure. I truly haven’t ever been on such a wondrous trip.
Likewise, Vespucci. You’ve taught me a great deal and I look forward to being your captain in the future.
And I look forward to our next adventure! Where do you think Command will send us next?

Fields.MenuText: I can’t wait to see the looks on their faces when we show them a duelist’s skill!
Vespucci. Have you ever heard of the phrase "it takes two to tango?"

Fields.DialogueText: Back in Cagliari. Smell that familiar air, Vespucci?
Search me. I hope that this time we don’t have to fight through waves of Morganas just to land somewhere.
I’ll be so fast that they’ll have to call me a shooting star! And to you? They’ll bow!
Capitano... ! I have. Are you really sure you want to dance with me?
Don’t wish for miracles, Capitano. Something tells me those Morganas will be around for a long time...
Well, at least I’ll have a comrade in arms to face them with should the time arise.
And I’ll have a capitano who’s there to point me toward the enemies and cheer me on while I gracefully dance among them!
Together with you, Vespucci. After all, every journey’s end...
... is a new beginning!
